“Virtual or virtueless?” Executive Board member Yves Mersch explains why virtual currencies like #Bitcoin are not money, nor will they be for the foreseeable future. Read the full speech here https://t.co/aJRiMZP6dB https://t.co/3EBEXip2lJ
Speech Peter Praet: Panel on global monetary policies – similarities and differences on the way to the new normal https://t.co/dJZ5tUGp7W
The ECB’s Twitter Q&A is over. Thank you for your questions. I really enjoyed this chat. Have a nice day! Peter Praet #AskECB https://t.co/d2t0YC7ak0

Praet: High inflation erodes income, which hurts the poor. Price stability is the best contribution that a central bank can make. Redistributive policy tools are in the hands of governments. #AskECB https://t.co/IvPsftKniQ

Praet: I agree that Brexit is a negative supply shock, which will affect the UK much more than the euro area. The intensity of the shock will depend on the outcome of the negotiations (to which the @ecb is not part!). Given uncertainty contingency planning is essential. #AskECB https://t.co/r3itABMzz6

Praet: Models are important to help us think about economic developments in a structured way, but the real economy is always more complex than models. Always to be complemented by other approaches, conjunctural analysis, and even anecdotal evidence! #AskECB https://t.co/nIF3zpQIQc
Praet: It wouldn't come to my mind to act beyond the law. #AskECB https://t.co/4dLCOMWUXd
Praet: It’s a textbook discussion! #AskECB https://t.co/7bb96nYkVS
Praet: I couldn't tell you the colour of Mario's tie... #AskECB https://t.co/RWDxkzRCeH
Praet: We all stand by our steadfast commitment to reach our inflation aim. Current discussions are more on tactics. #AskECB https://t.co/HKV836ulwI
Praet: Indeed, an important consideration, but not the only one. The fundamental consideration is the inflation outlook. #AskECB https://t.co/iuedONxpaR
Praet: We have always been clear on this. The sequencing is an essential part of our forward guidance that anchors interest rate expectations.  #AskECB https://t.co/H5p1DabKAR

Praet: Our forward guidance makes our policy more predictable and decreases uncertainty. Financial stability considerations are an integral part of our policy discussions. #AskECB https://t.co/RgzitOf2y4

Praet: As often communicated we consider a broad range of indicators. If I really had to pick one, I would take the simplest one: core inflation. But beware of such a simplistic approach! More here https://t.co/pqhomVTwgu #AskECB https://t.co/ofc8cl60zZ
Praet: In Praet indeed, but not in Peter. Listen here https://t.co/7mSZEGusuy #AskECB https://t.co/D235jox67O
Praet: Our staff is working on our macroeconomic projections for the March 8 Governing Council #AskECB https://t.co/GZpI7bsO8u
Praet: Positive rates are not a subsidy. Negative rates are not a tax, and they have decisively improved credit conditions and stimulated growth. #AskECB https://t.co/97nJgi6Qbs
Praet: No! #AskECB https://t.co/JnvaZsh9TO

Praet: Things are evolving according to our plan. Channels: APP has eased borrowing conditions for firms and households which has boosted job growth and investment. Forward guidance on rates will naturally increase in importance.  #AskECB https://t.co/gUC4eKt18d
@serbanmarian17 Praet: Don’t worry, we have tools, if and when we need them. But our baseline scenario is strong growth. #AskECB https://t.co/t1BdhRfcsm

Praet: Monetary history has shown that keeping prices stable is central banks’ best contribution to sustainable economic growth. Completing the banking union is key to the smooth functioning of the eurozone. #AskECB https://t.co/XZWmEEYwiZ
Praet: Fully in line with our baseline scenario for inflation #AskECB https://t.co/VNupCzoD7q
Praet: Our reaction will be fully in line with our forward guidance #AskECB https://t.co/fLvBBYzgxS

Praet: Business cycles are well alive, but don’t forget that they are affected by structural factors, productivity developments etc. See here for some studies #AskECB https://t.co/lImBxJI2gC https://t.co/et6MeIWliv
Praet: Eurostat is working on this. So far, data is only quarterly and not timely enough #AskECB https://t.co/fOW6GFAtzg
Praet: You are right, but I’ll manage #AskECB https://t.co/ZXCpR4QhL5
Good morning. This is Peter Praet from the ECB. Let’s start this Twitter Q&A on economic developments, using #AskECB https://t.co/ymANLMdEHj
Interview Yves Mersch with Bloomberg on cryptocurrencies https://t.co/FJmIoGAvVm
